sub_topic: Calculating the boiling and melting points of inorganic compounds
message_1: Calculate the melting point of sodium chloride (NaCl) given that its enthalpy of fusion is 28.9 kJ/mol and its entropy of fusion is 41.3 J/K/mol.
message_2:
To calculate the melting point of sodium chloride (NaCl), we can use the following equation:

Melting point (T) = Enthalpy of fusion (ΔH_fus) / Entropy of fusion (ΔS_fus)

Given the enthalpy of fusion (ΔH_fus) is 28.9 kJ/mol and the entropy of fusion (ΔS_fus) is 41.3 J/K/mol, we can plug these values into the equation:

T = (28.9 kJ/mol) / (41.3 J/K/mol)

First, we need to convert kJ/mol to J/mol:

28.9 kJ/mol * (1000 J/1 kJ) = 28900 J/mol

Now, we can plug this value back into the equation:

T = (28900 J/mol) / (41.3 J/K/mol)

T ≈ 700 K

Therefore, the melting point of sodium chloride (NaCl) is approximately 700 K.
